snippet: The earnings were partly the result of higher cable bills for 72 percent of Comcast’s subscribers.
abstract: Comcast reports a 17.4 percent increase in net income, to $1.44 billion, in the three months that ended March 31; solid earnings are partly the result of higher cable bills for 72 percent of Comcast's subscribers; company reports $3.07 billion in operating income and $15.3 billion in revenue, increases of 11.2 percent and 2.9 percent from the same quarter a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: The earnings were partly the result of higher cable bills for 72 percent of Comcast’s subscribers.

headline.seo: Comcast Posts 17% Increase in Net Income
headline.main: Higher Cable Bills Help Comcast Increase Profit by 17%
headline.print_headline: Higher Cable Bills Help Comcast Increase Profit by 17%
